q: Print US ex-defence head Donald Rumsfeld defends Iraq war handling Former US Defence Donald Rumsfeld remains largely defiant about the Iraq war, saying in a new book that had Saddam Hussein remained in power, the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today . Mr Donald Rumsfeld , 78, has written an autobiography due out next week. He concedes he could have sent more troops, and that internal US rivalries hampered post-war reconstruction. On the question

. Earlier on Sunday, Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand told US television that she had visited with Gabrielle Giffords the previous day and found her "doing great" and "making progress every day." Gabrielle Giffords is using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand told NBC's Meet The Press program. "It's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury," she added. The 40-year-old Gabrielle Giffords has survived

Carmelo Anthony and LeBron James were the headliners, but Allen Iverson and JR Josh Smith stole the show. Allen Iverson scored a season-high 37 points and Josh Smith added 29 to help the Denver Nuggets beat the Cleveland Cavaliers 122-100 on Monday night. They didn't steal my spotlight, said Carmelo Anthony , who had 22 points and nine rebounds. "They did what they were supposed to do. They took advantage of the defense that they threw at us." The congressman isn't criticizing John McCain 's decision, but says the senator's voice will be needed soon. It would be helpful for all of us to deal with the question of rhetoric, hyperbole, hate, and anger. John McCain has national prominence and prestige and it would be welcome for him to come and help change the tone. But John McCain has no plans to speak publicly, nor is the possibility even being discussed. " Barack Obama John McCain is not trying to politicize this tragedy, period," says his spokeswoman Brooke Buchanan,

Andy Coulson one degree of separation to the McCann affair: McCann family spokesman Clarence Mitchell joins CCHQ as head of media monitoring for the election www.prweek.com PR Week has the story: The Conservative Party has signed up Clarence Mitchell , best-known as spokesman for Madeleine McCann's parents, as the head of media monitoring for its general election campaign, PRWeek can exclusively reveal. " Clarence Mitchell joins the Tory comms operation today, reporting directly to director of communications Andy Coulson . Clarence Mitchell , who was the director of the Government's media monitoring unit for two years( 2005-2007) will take a back room role, monitoring the progress of the Tories' campaign in the media. Clarence Mitchell , a former BBC News presenter, is a member of the Conservative Party in north London and also Home Secretary Theresa May says the Government will wait for the outcome of the police phone hacking investigation.. "So far, I have been able to manage it," he said, but there will come a point in time when I have to go into the kitty and use other cash for this. Chrysler is working on making its gasoline engines more efficient with technology from partner Fiat SpA. The automaker will introduce an 8-speed automatic transmission on cars sold in the United States starting this year.
